title.narrative: ENABLING ENVIRONMENT FOR HIV PREVENTION, CARE AND TREATMENT

description.narrative: By 2020, key actors have the capacity required to plan, coordinate, monitor and evaluate integrated HIV/AIDS interventions based on evidence, gender equality and equity

mailing-address.narrative: Winston Churchill Avenue P.O. Box 1181 Yaoundé

sector.narrative: HIV and AIDS monitoring and bottleneck analysis
HIV health and community system strengthening to improve access and adherence
Social protection measures in support of HIV-AIDS treatment
Support Policy and guidance developments and address barriers to accessing HIV services by adolescents including gender mainstreaming
Technical assistance - Treatment and care of children living with HIV

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, key actors have the capacity required to plan, coordinate, monitor and evaluate integrated HIV/AIDS interventions based on evidence, gender equality and equity

description.narrative: UNICEF strengthened the environment to facilitate the deployment in the second semester. UNICEF supported the mid-term review and revision of the National HIV/AIDS Strategic Plan, the development of the 2021-2023 concept note to the Global Fund, the national COVID-19 concept note to mobilize additional resources to the Global Fund and a rapid assessment of the impact of COVID-19 on health services. For the IsDB project, UNICEF develop a concept note to mobilize 2.065 million USD to fight against COVID-19 and ensure the continuity of HIV care and treatment services for children, adolescents and pregnant women. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/06/2020

title.narrative: Number of health districts implementing evidence-based and equity informed HIV response plans
Number of regions equipped with monitoring plans of districts operational plans

National HIV Strategic plan/guidance for care and treatment that are aligned to Global targets and the most recent WHO recommendations for care and treatment of children , adolescents and pregnant/breast feeding women

baseline.value: Not aligned to the existing national strategic plan

actual.value: 2020:The 2018 - 2022 National Aids Strategic Plan has been reviewed and adjusted. Likewise, the new plan 2018 - 2023 is being implemented
